guicomponents
Class GPanel

java.lang.Object
  guicomponents.GComponent
      guicomponents.GPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable
public class GPanel
extends GComponent

A component that can be used to group GUI components that can be dragged, collapsed (leaves title tab only) and un-collapsed. When created the Panel is collapsed by default. To open the panel use setCollapsed(true); after creating it.

Author:
Peter Lager

Constructor Detail

GPanel

public GPanel(processing.core.PApplet theApplet,
              java.lang.String text,
              int x,
              int y,
              int width,
              int height,
              GCScheme colors,
              processing.core.PFont font)
Create a Panel that comprises of 2 parts the tab which is used to select and move the panel and the container window below the tab which is used to hold other components. The size of the container window will grow to fit components added provided that it does not exceed the width and height of the applet window.

Parameters:
theApplet - the PApplet reference
text - to appear on tab
x - horizontal position
y - vertical position
width - width of the panel
height - height of the panel (excl. tab)
colors - color to be used
font - font to be used

GPanel

public GPanel(processing.core.PApplet theApplet,
              java.lang.String text,
              int x,
              int y,
              int width,
              int height)
Create a Panel that comprises of 2 parts the tab which is used to select and move the panel and the container window below the tab which is used to hold other components. The size of the container window will grow to fit components added provided that it does not exceed the width and height of the applet window.

Parameters:
theApplet - the PApplet reference
text - to appear on tab
x - horizontal position
y - vertical position
width - width of the panel
height - height of the panel (excl. tab)

add

public boolean add(GComponent component)
Add a GUI component to this Panel at the position specified by component being added. Unregister the component for drawing this is managed by the Panel draw method to preserve z-ordering

Overrides:
add in class GComponent
Parameters:
component - to be added (ignored)
Returns:
always true

draw

public void draw()
Draw the panel. If tabOnly == true then display the tab only else draw tab and all child (added) components

Overrides:
draw in class GComponent

mouseEvent

public void mouseEvent(java.awt.event.MouseEvent event)
All GUI components are registered for mouseEvents

Overrides:
mouseEvent in class GComponent

isDragging

public boolean isDragging()
This method is used to discover whether the panel is being dragged to a new position on the screen.

Returns:
true if being dragged to a new position
